tool.name: ICM builder

param.name: infile
param.label: Trainings Dataset
param.help: A set of known genes in FASTA format.

param.name: depth
param.label: Set the depth of the ICM
param.help: The depth is the maximum number of positions in the context window that will be used to determine the probability of the predicted position.

param.name: period
param.label: Set the period of the ICM
param.help: The period is the number of different submodels for different positions in the text in a cyclic pattern. E.g., if the period is 3, the first submodel will determine positions 1, 4, 7, ...

param.name: width
param.label: Set the width of the ICM
param.help: The width includes the predicted position.

param.name: no_stops
param.label: Do not use any input strings with in-frame stop codons

param.name: genbank_gencode
param.label: Use Genbank translation table to specify stop codons
param.option: 4. Mold, Protozoan, and Coelenterate Mitochondrial Code and the Mycoplasma/Spiroplasma Code
6. Ciliate, Dasycladacean and Hexamita Nuclear Code

param.name: stop_codons
param.label: Specify stop codons as a comma-separated list

tool.help:
**What it does**
This program constructs an interpolated context model (ICM) from an input set of sequences. This model can be used by Glimmer3 to predict genes.
-----
**Example**
